title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on interagency coordination, collaboration with other organizations, communication with constituency groups, representation of scientific viewpoints, and setting priorities for addressing tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee advises on interagency coordination, collaboration, communication with groups, scientific representation, and setting priorities for tick-borne diseases. The Committee ensures a broad spectrum of scientific viewpoints in public health policy decisions and advises Federal agencies on Lyme and tick-borne disease priorities. Membership includes individuals not affiliated with the Federal Government, with representation from the scientific community, tick-borne disease organizations, and healthcare providers. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee membership includes representatives from various organizations and healthcare providers with experience in treating tick-borne diseases. The Secretary ensures diversity in appointing members to the committee. The Secretary appoints members to the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to ensure diversity in scientific perspectives. Ex officio members from various Federal agencies are designated as nonvoting representatives. The Secretary appoints members to the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee, including the Assistant Secretary for Health as co-chairperson. Members serve 4-year terms, with vacancies filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Committee holds public meetings, with notice provided, unless otherwise determined by the Secretary. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee members serve until successors take office, hold public meetings at least twice a year, and submit annual reports to the Secretary detailing their functions, members, and activities. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee submits annual reports to the Secretary, detailing functions, members, activities, and recommendations. $250,000 is authorized for each fiscal year for committee expenses under the Federal Advisory Committee Act.
